Description: Arm of a wooden figure; bent at the elbow; forearm connected to the upper arm by a mortise and tenon joint; one also at the shoulder; hand clenched to hold a staff; incised representation of Seth at the shoulder. There is a mortise at the elbow and the upper arm and lower arm are separate in the drawer. Marked '27' in ink. Size, quality and drawing of Seth is a match to EA45206.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 222)
